translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Book of the Middle Length Sayings

analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sa ni dassana ttika sa paccaya duka
translated: The Book of the Conditional Relations in Triads

original: Anidassanaappaṭigho appaccayo dhammo nasanidassanasappaṭighassa naappaccayassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anidassana appaṭighaḥ appaccayaḥ dhammaḥ na sanidassana sappaṭighassa na appaccayassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A conditionally-arisen, visible-data-base dhamma is related to a conditionally-arisen, impingeable dhamma as object condition.

original: Ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi, upanissaye tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi upanissaye tīṇi saṅkhitta
translated: In the object, there are three; in the predominance, there are three; in the support, there are three. (Abbreviated.)
